item.title: Gears of War: E-Day Developers Call It Their “Most Ambitious Game”
item.content:encoded:
The Coalition has given a brief but promising update on Gears of War: E-Day, which it claims is its ‘most ambitious’ title. While no release date has been announced for the prequel, it seems fans will have much to look forward to in 2026.

The Gears of War series, also known as Gears, has been going strong since 2006, almost 20 years ago. Following a ragtag group of soldiers, you’ll shoot (and chainsaw) your way through the parasitic Locust. With five titles, including a few spin-offs, the third-person shooter has become a staple for Xbox. While no sequel to 2019’s Gears 5 has been revealed, a prequel starring Marcus Fenix and Dom Santiago, called Gears of War: E-Day, was announced in 2024. A 2026 launch is still on the books and, now, the team has provided some new comments on the anticipated title.

Gears of War: E-Day to “Play Like Gears, But Play Like New”, Says Developers

In a year-end article from Xbox, many of the teams of 2025’s biggest games, like The Outer Worlds 2 and South of Midnight, discussed them and what they are looking forward to in 2026. One of the interviewees was Mike Crump, Studio Head at The Coalition for Gears of War: Reloaded. Asked about what the studio is looking forward to the most in 2026, Crump said the following:

“Next year marks the 20th anniversary of Gears of War, and we can’t think of a bigger way to celebrate than with the release of Gears of War: E-Day,” states Clump in the interview. “This is our most ambitious game yet, entirely built from scratch in Unreal Engine 5 to feel like Gears and play like new. This is a return to our roots as Marcus & Dom face the Locust for the first time ever. It’s the best place to jump into the Gears universe and we can’t wait to share more next year.“

As mentioned before, Gears of War: E-Day is planning to release sometime in 2026. No gameplay or additional trailers have been released since 2024. Still, the team at The Coalition and People Can Fly seem adamant the game will live up to expectations. Seeing as Gears 5 was an ambitious title in the series, E-Day may be what fans have been waiting for.

What do you think of The Coalition’s ambitious claim about Gears of War: E-Day? When do you think it will come out in 2026? What’s your favorite Gears title? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Gears, check out coverage on the best of the series and Reloaded’s PS5 release. Make sure to subscribe to the weekly newsletter!

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1644: Hints and Answer for December 19, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1644 for December 19, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, December 19, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1644 will be a little bit easier than yesterday’s. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.3 of 6 guesses. That makes over a full guess harder than the 5.5-guess average from December 18.

General Wordle Hints For December 19

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word comes from ancient history, not modern invention.
  • Hint 2: You’re far more likely to see it in religious or historical writing than in everyday speech.
  • Hint 3: It’s often mentioned alongside other symbolic items like Gold and Frankincense, rather than standing alone.
  • Hint 4: The word looks unusual because it relies more on consonant repetition than vowel variety.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1644 for December 19, 2025

Starter Words For December 19, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • MERRY
  • MIRTH
  • RHYME
  • HURRY

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1644 On December 19, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: MYRRH

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

MYRRH is a noun that means “an aromatic resinous exudation from certain plants of the genus Myrrhis, especially M. odorata, a small spiny tree: used for incense, perfume, etc.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1643 on December 18, 2025:

Answer: RUGBY

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1644?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on December 20 will be Wordle Game #1645.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Universal Tower Defense Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these active Roblox Universal Tower Defense monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Gems, Trait Rerolls, Stat Locks and much more.

Universal Tower Defense shares several gameplay similarities with other prominent anime-based Roblox titles. The game is all about summoning the best Units and deploying them in defense battles across various maps and acts. Instead of spending gruelling hours to farm Gems, you can simply redeem the active Universal Tower Defense codes. These codes not only offer free Gems, but also Trait Rerolls and Stat Locks. New players can easily get their hands on their rarest and strongest Units much earlier into the game. Veterans can further strengthen their anime squad by using these freebies.

Active Universal Tower Defense Codes

Inactive Universal Tower Defense Codes

  • ThankYouEA!

How To Redeem Universal Tower Defense Codes 

Follow these steps to activate all the active codes in Universal Tower Defense: 

  1. Launch Universal Tower Defense and spawn in the lobby. 
  2. Press the “Codes” button on the right side of the screen. 
  3. Copy any active code and paste it into the “Enter Code Here” text box. 
  4. Click the “Redeem” button to claim the free rewards. 

More About Universal Tower Defense Codes

Traits play an important part in UTD as players must use these special powerups to increase their units’ overall impact and performance. Use the free Trait Rerolls to obtain the strongest Traits without splashing Robux. Here are all the Traits, their roll chances, and usage in Universal Tower Defense: 

  • Enhanced – 26.67% – + Damage
  • Agile – 24.98% – Cooldown
  • Precise – 24.49% – + Range
  • Prodigy – 9.99% – +50% Unit Experience 
  • Lethal – 5% – +15% Critical Rate; +30% Damage on enemies with 50% or less health 
  • Deadeye – 2.5% – +20% Range
  • Lightspeed – 1.5% – -20% Cooldown
  • Fortunate (Farms only!) – 1% – +20% income
  • Duelist – 0.8% – +25% Critical Rate; +20% Range, and +35% Boss Damage
  • Artificer – 0.65% – Increases stats gained from relics by 15% 
  • Wizard – 0.5% – +30% DoT Damage, -15% Cooldown, and +20% Range
  • Astral – 0.45% – +20% Affliction Duration, -20% Cooldown, +15% Range, DoT can now stack, limits to 1 placement
  • Sacred – 0.3% – +25% Damage, -10% Cooldown, +25% Range, and -15% Cast
  • Eternal – 0.2% – -20% Cooldown, +2% Damage, and +1% Range per wave (25 wave cap, 50% Damage and 20% Range)
  • Fission – 0.15% – +15% Damage, -15% Cooldown, +25% Range, adds Radiant DoT
  • Ruler – 0.1% – +200 Damage, -20% cooldown, +30% Range, limits to 1 placement

You can summon 1 Unit using 50 Gems and 10 using 500. Using the free Gems obtained from the active codes, you can easily summon hundreds of units within a few minutes. 

FAQs On Universal Tower Defense Codes

Can any active UTD codes redeemed for Traits? 

As of now, one of the codes offers Traits upon redemption. 

What are the latest codes in Universal Tower Defense? 

ThankYou100k, HereyougoEA!, ThousandsOfCodes!, and MaxedOut! are the latest active codes in Universal Tower Defense. 

Where to find new UTD codes? 

Follow the developer’s social media handle or keep an eye on our active codes list to spot the newest codes once they debut.

Be sure to check out our Insider Gaming Discord Server, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best gem-hunting Roblox games.

If you’re a big fan of Roblox and play a lot of games, you can also check out our code guides for other popular Roblox titles like Steal an Anime, Steal Star Wars, and Mini Empires.

item.title: Former Larian Employees Fire Back at Boss’s AI Comments
item.content:encoded:
Former Larian employees have responded to the CEO’s recent comments about AI, with one saying, “Show your employees some respect.”

Larian has been a hot topic in the news lately and not always for the best reasons. Last week, we saw Larian reveal Divinity, which brought some hype into the fan base. However, a few days ago, the Larian boss’s comments on AI caught fire on social media, and now former employees are responding.

Former Employee Claims Larian Boss is Lying About Staff Being Okay with AI Use

For a few days, Larian has been taking flak for using AI. Swen Vincke, the founder, stated, “I think at this point everyone at the company is more or less OK with the way we’re using it.” Spotted by GamesRadar+, a former employee has responded to the comment, stating that Larian is lying about everyone in the company being okay with it.

Anne Méthot, a former QA tester at Larian on X (formerly Twitter), has stated that, after working at Larian, they aren’t surprised by the new AI stuff, alleging that Swen Vincke is “lying about people being okay with it”. Another former employee, Selena Tobin, has also stated that they “loved working at Larian studios until AI”. Tobin asked the developers to show their employees some respect, as they are world-class and “do not need AI assistance to come up with amazing ideas.”

Swen Vincke has already posted on X to say they aren’t “pushing hard” to replace concept artists with AI. A new post on X also states that their “successes come from empowering people to work in their own way and bring the best out of their skill & craft, so that we can make the best RPGs we can possibly make. In that context, it would be irresponsible for us not to evaluate new technologies. However, our processes are always evolving, and where they are not efficient or fail to align with who we are, we will make changes.” Larian will hold an Ask Me Anything after the holiday break to provide more insight.

In other news, new Divinity will feature turn-based and co-op gameplay and plans to follow the same early access format as previous Larian games. What are your thoughts on former Larian employees firing back at the boss’s AI comments? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about The Division receiving a 60 FPS update for PS5 in 2025. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: The Division Receives 60 FPS Update for PS5 in 2025
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft has announced a new 60 FPS update for The Division on PS5, making the game better suited for current-gen consoles.

In 2025, all we have heard about the Tom Clancy’s Division franchise is details on the sequel. Last we heard about the game was in August, when we received the Year 7 Roadmap, and it was also revealed that the game was ‘saved’ by a team of 5 developers. Now, towards the end of the year, a new announcement has arrived for the 2016 The Division game.

The Division Now Has 60 FPS on PS5

Revealed by a new post on X (formerly Twitter), Tom Clancy’s The Division is the latest 2016 title to receive a current-gen update in 2025. However, the new update only increases the framerate to 60 FPS; there are no details about the resolution. The blog post states that players can expect smoother gameplay in the snow-covered streets of New York thanks to the enhanced performance.

Tom Clancy’s The Division centers on a deadly pandemic that has struck New York City. You are part of a unit of tactical agents that are trained to operate independently to save society. The title features a massive co-op campaign, where you can join other agents to fight the outbreak in Manhattan, across a wide range of story missions and open-world activities. The map features dynamic events, loot, and crafting of new weapons and gear. Players also have tons of different modes to play through, including ncursions, Underground, Survival, the Dark Zone, and more.

In other news, Ubisoft has acquired the developers of March of Giants. Additionally, the director of Splinter Cell Remake has returned to Ubisoft to finish the game. What are your thoughts on The Division getting a 60 FPS update for PS5 in 2025? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about NVIDIA reportedly cutting RTX 50 series production in 2026. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
